intro: Erycibe ramiflora, commonly known as the ramiflorous erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can grow quite large, often reaching up to 30 centimeters in diameter. Erycibe ramiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and adaptability to warm, humid climates.
